title: my perma-ban.
body:
hi everyone.
i'd like to say that i'm ashamed as i never thought i'd do/say the things that got me banned.
the thing is i got rightfully banned almost 2 years ago for being toxic, and i just want to know if the community is welling to give me a second chance 2 years later ? 
- this is my first time to talk about it and my last. because i am deeply embarrassed of myself and how i used to be.
i just want to say that i learned from my mistakes and would love to join back to the community as a new person.

so my question is : is there anyway i can recover my account ? if not I totally understand because like i said before i was an awful person, and maybe that's what i deserve.

thanks.

replies.body:
I'm happy people change, but its a no.

you already caused damage 2 years ago when you ruined the game for your teammates.
sorry man.

I'll grind with u any time tho.

Is there a way to recovery the account? Yes. 

Does Riot's current policy allow it? Sadly, no.
im sorry i didnt understand the part "current policy" would you explain it. and thx for the replay

Riot can lock and unlock any account at any time with or without reason. So can they unlock your account? Yes they can. 

Will they unlock it though? The current policy is that accounts that are punished correctly will not be unlocked.  So will they unlock your account? They won't.

I think what that person was trying to say is that, while Riot could give you the account back, because of their policy (once an account is rightfully ban, there is no way of getting it back) You cant get your account back.

The only true way to show you reformed is to make a new account and do well on that, despite knowing that you can never get your original account back.

No you can't get your account back

if you want to play this game again, make a new account
